context: When an individual has encountered a wide range of experiences or has deep knowledge in a particular area, they are often able to understand and navigate complex or unfamiliar situations with ease. This typically applies to people who have traveled extensively, studied broadly, or been exposed to diverse perspectives and environments, allowing them to make informed judgments and decisions.

definition: to incite a quarrel (idiom);  to sow discord between people; to tell tales; to make mischief
context: When someone deliberately stirs up conflict by spreading rumors, twisting facts, or encouraging disagreement between others, often for personal gain or out of malice. This behavior typically involves manipulating situations to create or worsen tensions where there was previously harmony. It can occur in personal, professional, or community settings where relationships are undermined by false or exaggerated information.

definition: to conceal one's identity; living incognito
context: When an individual deliberately avoids recognition or public attention by keeping their personal identity private or secret. This often occurs in situations where someone wishes to start a new life away from past associations, avoid scrutiny, or escape responsibilities and consequences. It reflects a pattern of withdrawal from public visibility to maintain anonymity.

definition: to love sth too much to part with it (idiom)
context: When a person is deeply attached to an object, idea, or relationship and finds it emotionally difficult to let go, even when it may no longer be practical or beneficial. This often occurs when sentimental value, habit, or strong affection makes the thought of separation painful or unacceptable.

definition: shrimp soldiers and crab generals (in mythology or popular fiction, the army of the Dragon King of the Eastern Sea); useless troops (idiom)
context: When a group or set of individuals is described as being weak, unskilled, or ineffective, especially when presented as an opposing or supporting force. It often refers to a poorly equipped or inadequately led team that lacks the strength or capability to achieve meaningful results. The term is used to downplay the significance or threat posed by such a group.

definition: completely lacking any feeling or sense of justice (idiom);  cold and ruthless
context: When a person shows complete disregard for emotions, relationships, or moral obligations, treating others with indifference or cruelty. This often describes behavior that is harsh, unforgiving, and devoid of compassion or fairness in interpersonal or ethical situations. It typically applies to those who prioritize self-interest or cold logic over empathy or justice.

definition: see 天荒地老[tian1 huang1 di4 lao3]
context: When a situation or condition has persisted for an extremely long time, seemingly without end, emphasizing its timelessness or stagnation. It can also convey the idea of enduring love, devotion, or commitment that lasts through all changes and challenges, no matter how long they may endure.

definition: to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom);  striving to the utmost
context: When an individual dedicates themselves wholeheartedly to a task or duty, putting in maximum effort without concern for personal gain or comfort. This often describes someone who is deeply committed, works tirelessly, and gives their all until the very end in pursuit of a goal or responsibility.

definition: lit. name is not in vain (idiom);  a fully justified reputation; enjoys a well-deserved reputation
context: When a person, place, or thing is widely regarded with high esteem and lives up to the positive expectations associated with it. This phrase is used when the actual experience or outcome fully matches and confirms the established reputation, emphasizing that the praise or recognition is well-founded. It applies to any scenario where reality supports and validates the acclaim or notoriety that something has gained over time.

definition: impassioned; vehement
context: When a person expresses intense emotion or strong conviction, especially in speech or action, showing a passionate and fervent attitude. This often occurs in contexts where there is a call to action, a powerful argument, or an inspiring appeal that stirs deep feelings and determination.

definition: a common occurrence (idiom)
context: When a particular event, behavior, or phenomenon occurs so frequently that it no longer surprises or impresses people, it is considered normal or unremarkable. This often happens in environments where repetition leads to a lack of reaction or response, as people become accustomed to seeing the same thing over and over. It applies to any situation where something is so familiar that it is no longer perceived as unusual or noteworthy.

definition: born at the wrong time (idiom);  unlucky (esp. to complain about one's fate); born under an unlucky star; ahead of his time
context: When an individual's talents, ideas, or efforts go unrecognized or unappreciated due to the unfavorable circumstances or era in which they live. This often occurs when someone is either too advanced for their time or enters a situation that lacks the conditions necessary for their success. It reflects a sense of misfortune tied to timing rather than personal failure.

definition: lit. you can sing or you can cry (idiom);  fig. deeply moving; happy and sad; inspiring and tragic
context: When a story or event contains both moments of great heroism and deep sorrow, it can be described as profoundly emotional and impactful. Such situations often highlight the strength and courage of individuals facing adversity, while also evoking a sense of sadness or tragedy. These narratives tend to resonate deeply with people, inspiring admiration and emotional reflection.

definition: every hope turns to dust (idiom);  completely disheartened
context: When a person feels that all possibilities and hopes have been lost, leading to a deep sense of despair and emptiness. This often occurs after experiencing major setbacks, failures, or a series of disappointments that strip away motivation and optimism. It reflects a state where emotional energy is drained and the will to continue or believe in positive outcomes has faded.

definition: unable to move a single step (idiom); to be in an (extremely) difficult situation
context: When an individual or group faces overwhelming obstacles that prevent even the smallest progress, no matter the effort applied. It describes situations where movement or advancement is nearly impossible due to external constraints, internal limitations, or adverse conditions. This can occur in personal, professional, or systemic contexts where every attempt to proceed meets resistance or failure.

definition: unnamed hero
context: Individuals who make significant contributions without seeking recognition or public acclaim, often working behind the scenes. These are people whose efforts go unnoticed by the general public but play a crucial role in achieving success or maintaining stability in a situation.

definition: standing above the common crowd (idiom);  outstanding; excellent and unrivaled
context: When an individual or achievement demonstrates exceptional quality that clearly sets it apart from others, showing a level of excellence that is difficult to match. It applies in contexts where there is a clear distinction between the ordinary and the extraordinary, and where superiority is both evident and respected.

definition: deeply worried and sick at heart (idiom)
context: When a person is burdened with intense and persistent anxiety, especially over matters beyond their control, leading to a state of emotional distress. This often occurs in situations involving significant personal, professional, or societal pressures that seem overwhelming and unresolved. It reflects a deep inner turmoil and a troubled state of mind, where worry takes a toll on one's well-being.

definition: lit. as if enumerating one's family valuables (idiom); fig. to be very familiar with a matter
context: When a person speaks about a subject with detailed knowledge and effortless recollection, often listing facts or items with great confidence and familiarity. This applies when someone demonstrates an intimate understanding of a topic, as if it is well-known and close to them, typically in discussions, presentations, or conversations where expertise is evident. It is commonly used to describe someone who has spent significant time with or has a deep personal connection to the subject matter.

definition: flustered and exasperated; utterly discomfited
context: When a person becomes extremely frustrated and agitated due to an unexpected or uncontrollable situation, showing signs of losing composure and rationality. This often occurs when efforts to achieve a goal repeatedly fail, or when faced with criticism, setbacks, or challenges that disrupt their plans or expectations. The reaction typically involves outward displays of anger, impatience, or disarray.

definition: to walk quietly on tiptoe (idiom)
context: When someone moves with extreme quietness to avoid being noticed, especially in situations where making noise could lead to disruption or detection. This often occurs in settings where stealth is necessary or desired, such as in the presence of others who are unaware or in need of rest. It reflects a deliberate and cautious approach to physical movement.

definition: lit. not requiring a detailed understanding (idiom);  only looking for an overview; not bothered with the details; superficial; content with shallow understanding
context: When someone approaches a task or subject with a general interest rather than a desire for in-depth knowledge, showing a preference for grasping the main idea over mastering the finer points. This often applies to situations where a person is satisfied with a basic understanding and does not feel the need to explore further or engage in thorough analysis. It can describe attitudes in learning, reading, or decision-making where depth is overlooked in favor of simplicity or convenience.

definition: extravagant (idiom);  to throw away money by the handful; wasteful
context:
When someone spends money without care or restraint, often leading to unnecessary waste or excess.  
This typically describes behavior where resources are used in an overly generous or careless manner, without regard for value or future needs.  
It applies to situations where financial prudence is overlooked in favor of indulgence or showy displays of spending.

definition: lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom); fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful; also written 傾城傾國|倾城倾国[qing1 cheng2 qing1 guo2]
context: When describing an individual, particularly a woman, whose beauty is so extraordinary that it captures immense admiration and can seemingly influence or captivate entire groups or societies. It is used in contexts where someone’s charm or allure is portrayed as powerful enough to shift attention, stir emotions, or even metaphorically disrupt normal order. The phrase often appears in literary, dramatic, or poetic expressions to emphasize overwhelming attractiveness or impact.

definition: lit. doesn't hurt, doesn't tickle (idiom);  sth is wrong, but not quite sure what; fig. not getting to any matter of substance; scratching the surface; superficial; perfunctory
context: When an issue is noticed but not significant enough to cause concern or prompt action, it often remains unaddressed and overlooked. This can describe situations where feedback or criticism is given without real impact, failing to reach the core of the problem. It reflects a lack of depth or urgency in responses, often leaving matters unresolved or only partially acknowledged.

definition: the more the better
context: When a person or situation benefits from an increasing amount of a particular resource, input, or option, and improvement or success is seen as proportional to its quantity. It is often used to describe preferences, opportunities, or advantages where abundance is viewed positively and limitations are considered unnecessary.

definition: (idiom) to gasp in amazement; to acclaim as the peak of perfection
context: When something is considered so impressive, extraordinary, or flawless that it leaves people in awe. This can apply when encountering exceptional art, performances, achievements, or natural wonders that exceed expectations and are regarded as the pinnacle of their kind. It is often used to express admiration for something that reaches a level of perfection or grandeur rarely seen.

definition: without learning or skills (idiom);  ignorant and incompetent
context: When a person lacks both knowledge and practical abilities, making them unsuitable for a task or role that requires competence. This often applies to those who have not made an effort to develop their skills or educate themselves, leading to poor performance or decision-making in various situations. It can describe individuals in professional, academic, or personal contexts who are seen as unqualified due to their ignorance and inability.

definition: lit. body and shadow follow each other (idiom); fig. inseparable
context: When two people or entities are constantly together and maintain a close, unbreakable connection, regardless of circumstances or time. This can describe relationships or partnerships characterized by loyalty, dependency, or an unshakable bond, where one is rarely seen or experienced without the other.

definition: to anxiously await
context: When a person is eagerly and impatiently waiting for a long-awaited outcome, event, or arrival, especially one they deeply care about. This expression fits situations where the waiting is intense, prolonged, and filled with anticipation or expectation. It often reflects emotional investment and the feeling that time is passing slowly due to the significance of what is being awaited.

definition: original and ingenious (idiom); to show great creativity
context: When an individual or group demonstrates a unique and creative approach to problem-solving or artistic expression, going beyond conventional methods to produce something original and insightful. It refers to situations where exceptional imagination and skill lead to innovative results that stand out due to their originality and depth of thought.

definition: pavilion in the air (idiom);  unrealistic Utopian construction; castles in Spain; imaginary future plans
context: When plans, ideas, or goals are based on unrealistic or impractical assumptions, disconnected from the actual circumstances or resources available. It refers to aspirations or structures that lack a solid foundation in reality, making them unlikely to succeed or materialize. This often occurs when people ignore practical limitations or fail to consider real-world constraints in their thinking or decision-making.

definition: lit. enough books to make a pack-ox sweat or to fill a house to the rafters (idiom);  fig. many books
context: When an individual or organization possesses an extensive collection of written materials, such as books, documents, or records, to the point of overwhelming storage space. It also refers to situations where the sheer volume of material amassed reflects a deep or excessive engagement with knowledge, study, or documentation.

definition: lit. hunting deer in the Central Plain (idiom); fig. to attempt to seize the throne
context:
When multiple powerful individuals or factions compete for supreme authority or dominance in a region or organization.  
It often refers to intense political or strategic struggles where the ultimate goal is to take control or establish leadership.  
This can occur during times of instability, transition, or when existing power structures are weakened or dissolved.

definition: to ask oneself honestly; to search in one's heart
context:
When a person is faced with a moral dilemma or uncertain about their own intentions, and needs to reflect deeply on their true feelings or values.  
It applies when honesty with oneself is necessary to determine the right course of action or to acknowledge personal shortcomings.  
This is often used in moments of internal conflict or self-evaluation, urging genuine introspection rather than superficial reasoning.

definition: covering the whole land; over hills and dales
context: When a scene is described as being filled with a vast number of people, objects, or elements spread densely across an open landscape, especially in a natural or rural setting. It suggests overwhelming abundance or coverage, often used to convey a sense of magnitude, intensity, or all-encompassing presence in a given area.

definition: to run this way and that (idiom);  to rush about busily; to bustle about; to hopscotch; also 東跑西顛|东跑西颠[dong1 pao3 xi1 dian1]
context: When someone is moving quickly and constantly in different directions without a clear or consistent path, often due to being busy, scattered, or chasing multiple tasks or goals at once. This can apply in situations where a person is trying to manage several responsibilities, helping others in different places, or feeling disoriented and unable to settle in one place. It reflects a state of restless activity and a lack of focus or direction.

definition: first decapitate then present your trophy (idiom);  act first, report later
context: When an individual takes decisive action without prior authorization or approval, later seeking validation for their decision. This often occurs in hierarchical or formal settings where protocol is typically followed, but urgency or confidence in the decision leads to acting first and informing or justifying afterward.

definition: to bring honor to one's ancestors
context: When an individual achieves notable success or recognition that reflects positively on their family background, especially through academic, professional, or moral excellence. This often occurs in contexts where personal achievement is seen as elevating the family's social standing or legacy. It typically involves actions or accomplishments that are deeply respected within cultural or familial traditions.

definition: to be unable to find a solution; to be at wits' end
context: When a person faces a difficult problem but lacks the ideas or resources to make progress. This often occurs in challenging circumstances where every possible approach has been tried without success, leading to a sense of helplessness and frustration. It describes a state of being stuck without a clear way forward, regardless of the personal or professional context.

definition: everybody celebrating together; universal celebration; universal rejoicing
context: This phrase refers to a time or occasion when people from all parts of the world or all sectors of society come together to share in a common feeling of joy and celebration. It typically describes significant, positive events that have broad impact and are widely recognized and appreciated. It emphasizes unity and collective happiness rather than individual or localized experiences.

definition: to satisfy rival demands (idiom); to get the best of both worlds; to have it both ways; to have one's cake and eat it too
context: When a situation allows for multiple positive outcomes to be achieved simultaneously, especially when those outcomes might typically be seen as conflicting or mutually exclusive. This often occurs in decisions or strategies that manage to satisfy different sides of an issue, maintaining harmony or advantage across all involved areas.

definition: lit. to fall behind Sun Shan 孫山|孙山[Sun1 Shan1] (who came last in the imperial examination) (idiom); fig. to fail an exam; to fall behind (in a competition)
context: When someone ends up in last place or fails to achieve success in a competitive setting, especially after putting in effort or having high hopes. This typically applies to academic, professional, or public contests where results are ranked or publicly announced. It reflects the disappointment of not meeting expectations or falling short despite participation.

definition: that which is yearned for by the public
context: When a cause, leader, or idea gains widespread support and is seen as the natural or just direction by the majority, especially in times of social or political change. It describes situations where public sentiment consistently aligns with a particular movement or choice, reflecting shared values or aspirations. This often occurs when there is a strong collective desire for fairness, progress, or resolution to a pressing issue.

definition: fiends (idiom);  devils and monsters
context: When a group or individual displays an intimidating, threatening, or violent demeanor that instills fear or discomfort in others. It refers to situations where the presence or behavior of people is overwhelmingly harsh or malevolent, often creating a hostile or oppressive atmosphere. This can occur in confrontations, power struggles, or environments dominated by aggression and fear.

definition: where the wind and the waves are the fiercest; at the heart of the struggle
context: When an individual or entity finds themselves at the center of intense pressure, public attention, or turbulent circumstances, facing challenges from multiple directions. This often occurs in high-stakes environments where decisions or actions have significant consequences, and where external forces are colliding forcefully. It describes being in the most intense part of a conflict, controversy, or dynamic situation where conditions are unstable and demanding.

definition: (of a text) very lengthy (idiom)
context: When a piece of writing is excessively detailed and lengthy, to the point of being tedious or overwhelming, regardless of the subject or purpose. This often occurs when there is an overemphasis on elaboration, repetition, or unnecessary expansion of ideas, making the content difficult to engage with or lose its clarity. It typically describes situations where brevity would be more effective, but the text extends far beyond what is necessary or appropriate.

definition: joy from heaven (idiom);  overjoyed at unexpected good news; unlooked-for happy event
context: When an individual receives unexpected good news that brings sudden happiness or fortune, regardless of the circumstances or timing. This can apply to any scenario where a positive, surprising event occurs that significantly improves someone's situation or mood.

definition: to develop and promote; to carry forward; to bring to great height of development
context: When a tradition, idea, or achievement is actively built upon and promoted to achieve broader recognition or greater success. It refers to efforts to enhance and sustain a positive legacy, ensuring it continues to thrive and influence future generations. This often involves innovation, promotion, and dedication to elevate something to a higher level of impact or prestige.

definition: lit. green hills and clear waters; pleasant country scene (idiom)
context: When describing naturally beautiful and serene landscapes, especially those that evoke a sense of harmony between earth and water. It also applies to situations emphasizing the preservation of untouched or unspoiled environments that bring peace and aesthetic pleasure.

definition: to do more than is required (idiom);  superfluous; gilding the lily
context: When an action is taken that is unnecessary and adds no real value, often complicating a situation that was already sufficient or complete. This typically occurs when someone tries to improve or enhance something that doesn't require it, leading to wasted effort or even negative consequences. It reflects a pattern of overcomplicating matters by including extra steps or elements that are redundant.

definition: to get ready (for a journey); ready and waiting
context: When a person or group has fully prepared for an upcoming task, event, or journey and is in a state of readiness, waiting for the appropriate moment to begin. It often describes a situation where all necessary arrangements have been made and the final stage is simply awaiting a signal or opportunity to move forward. This can apply to a variety of contexts, such as travel, work projects, or strategic planning.

definition: see 路見不平，拔刀相助|路见不平，拔刀相助[lu4 jian4 bu4 ping2 , ba2 dao1 xiang1 zhu4]
context: When an injustice or unfair situation is observed, and someone takes immediate and direct action to help or defend the wronged party. This often involves standing up courageously in the face of wrongdoing, even if it is not directly related to oneself. It reflects a sense of moral responsibility and a readiness to intervene when others may hesitate.

definition: to shout and quarrel; to make a big fuss
context: When people react in an overly loud or dramatic manner to a minor problem or disagreement, drawing unnecessary attention to themselves. This often involves emotional outbursts or exaggerated expressions of frustration, typically in public or shared spaces. It reflects a tendency to escalate small issues through loud behavior rather than addressing them calmly.

definition: lit. a pearl in the palm (idiom); fig. beloved person (esp. daughter)
context:
When someone is deeply cherished and regarded as precious, especially within a family or close-knit group.  
It often refers to a child, particularly a daughter, who is adored and given special care and attention.  
This expression applies to situations where an individual is seen as a source of pride and affection, often protected or pampered due to their valued status.

definition: to make up for one's faults by doing good deeds (idiom)
context: When an individual or group attempts to counterbalance past mistakes or negative actions by performing positive or corrective actions. This often occurs in situations where there is an effort to redeem one's reputation, restore trust, or demonstrate improvement after a failure or wrongdoing. It reflects a pattern of seeking to offset shortcomings through subsequent good behavior or contributions.

definition: transient; fleeting
context: When an opportunity, moment, or state of being is brief and easily disappears if not recognized or acted upon quickly, it is often described as something that does not last and must be seized in the moment. This applies to experiences or conditions that are inherently short-lived and can vanish as soon as they are overlooked or taken for granted.

definition: dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless;  at a loss for words
context: When someone is completely unable to respond to a compelling argument, overwhelming evidence, or an embarrassing situation, leaving them at a loss for words. This often occurs in confrontational or critical moments where there is no clear defense or explanation to offer. It reflects a state of being so shocked, convinced, or defeated that verbal response becomes impossible.

definition: without good cause
context: When an action is taken or a statement is made without any clear reason or justification, appearing arbitrary or unwarranted. It is often used to describe situations where blame, suspicion, or treatment is given unfairly, with no apparent basis. The phrase highlights a lack of evidence or rationale behind the behavior in question.

definition: misfortune turns to blessing (idiom);  to turn an inauspicious start to good account
context: When an unfavorable or dangerous situation unexpectedly leads to a positive outcome due to timely action, adaptability, or fortune. This often occurs when challenges are met with resourcefulness, allowing potential harm to be transformed into opportunity. It describes the pattern of facing adversity that somehow results in greater good or avoids negative consequences.

definition: see 一決雌雄|一决雌雄[yi1 jue2 ci2 xiong2]
context: When two parties are in direct competition and there is a strong desire to determine a clear winner or establish superiority, especially in a decisive or intense confrontation. This often applies in situations where the outcome will settle a long-standing rivalry, highlight strength or skill, or resolve a conflict through a final showdown.

definition: lit. lovely flowers, round moon (idiom);  fig. everything is wonderful; perfect happiness; conjugal bliss
context: A time of life when all aspects are in harmony and going smoothly, especially in relationships or family life, and when conditions are ideal or especially joyful. It often refers to moments of unity, fulfillment, and emotional satisfaction that come together at once.

definition: not stick to one pattern
context: When an individual or organization is overly rigid in their approach, refusing to consider alternative methods or perspectives, this expression describes the tendency to remain confined within a single framework. It applies to scenarios where flexibility and openness to diverse ideas or solutions are overlooked in favor of consistency with tradition or convention.

definition: as the water recedes, the rocks appear (idiom); the truth comes to light
context: When circumstances become clearer after a period of confusion or obscurity, allowing hidden facts or realities to become visible. This often occurs after events unfold, evidence accumulates, or external pressures subside, revealing what was previously concealed. It applies to any situation where truth or clarity emerges following a time of uncertainty or complexity.

definition: (idiom) to be inordinately proud of one's ability;  to be conceited and contemptuous
context: When an individual excessively believes in their own talents or skills to the point of looking down on others or refusing to collaborate, regardless of the field or situation. This often leads to isolation or conflict, as the person's arrogance and disdain for others hinder mutual respect and effective cooperation.

definition: to search one's guts and belly (idiom);  to racks one's brains for a solution
context: When someone is deeply engaged in a challenging mental task and is making a great effort to come up with an idea, solution, or answer. This often involves intense concentration and the feeling of exhausting one's mental resources in an attempt to find something meaningful or creative.

definition: to be effective (idiom)
context: When a method, strategy, or approach has been tested and consistently produces good results, it can be described as something that has proven successful over time. This applies in various contexts where a solution has been applied repeatedly and continues to work well without the need for major adjustments. It emphasizes reliability and effectiveness through practical application rather than theoretical appeal.

definition: many men, a great force (idiom);  many hands provide great strength; There is safety in numbers.
context: When a group's influence or power grows significantly due to its large size or numbers, making it more difficult to oppose or challenge. This often applies in situations where collective action or presence leads to greater authority, protection, or impact than individuals acting alone. It reflects the idea that unity and numerical strength can create a formidable advantage in various social, political, or organizational contexts.

definition: lit. a bird startled by the mere twang of a bow (idiom); fig. sb who frightens easily, due to past experiences
context: When an individual or group reacts with fear or anxiety to a harmless or non-threatening situation because of past trauma or negative experiences, this pattern often leads to unnecessary avoidance or heightened stress. Such reactions typically stem from lingering memories or deeply ingrained fears, making it hard for the person to assess the current situation objectively. This tendency can manifest in various aspects of life, including work, relationships, or new opportunities.

definition: brothers in hardship (idiom); fellow sufferers; in the same boat
context: When two people find themselves facing similar difficulties or challenges, and both are equally affected by the same circumstances. This often implies that neither is better off than the other, and both are struggling in the same way. It can apply to personal, professional, or societal situations where shared hardship creates a sense of mutual understanding or equal suffering.

definition: immortality
context: When a person, idea, or system is said to persist indefinitely without showing signs of decline, decay, or end, it is often used to describe an enduring presence that seems beyond the natural limits of time or aging. This can refer to beliefs, traditions, or even myths that are thought to last forever and remain untouched by the passage of time or the inevitability of change.

definition: impossible to unravel; confusing
context: When events or circumstances are complex and unclear, making it difficult to determine the truth or the correct course of action. This often involves situations filled with confusion, misleading information, or multiple intertwining factors that obscure understanding. It can apply to investigations, narratives, or scenarios where clarity is hard to achieve despite efforts to sort out the details.

definition: to set an example (idiom);  to serve as a model
context: When an individual demonstrates desired behavior or values in order to influence or guide others, especially in positions of authority or responsibility. This often occurs in settings where leadership, moral conduct, or consistency in actions play a key role in shaping the behavior of a group or community. It reflects the idea that actions speak louder than words, and that leading through example can be more effective than verbal instruction.

definition: variant of 萎靡不振[wei3 mi3 bu4 zhen4]
context: When a person or group shows a lack of energy, enthusiasm, or motivation, and remains in a state of low spirits or depression for an extended period. This can apply to individuals, teams, or organizations that fail to recover from setbacks or show signs of renewed vigor. It often describes a prolonged condition of discouragement or lethargy without clear direction or drive.

definition: everything clear and in good order (idiom);  neat and tidy
context: When a space, system, or process is structured in a way that allows for easy understanding and efficient operation, with each element clearly placed or defined. This can apply to physical environments, organizational practices, or even abstract systems where clarity and methodical arrangement contribute to effectiveness and harmony.

definition: Four Treasures of the Study, namely 筆|笔[bi3], 墨[mo4], 紙|纸[zhi3] and 硯|砚[yan4]; the essentials of calligraphy and scholarship (idiom)
context: When referring to the essential tools and refined traditions of scholarly or artistic practice, especially in the context of writing, calligraphy, or intellectual cultivation. It may also symbolize a dedication to classical methods and the appreciation of cultural heritage in creative or academic pursuits.

definition: to steal away; to beat it
context: When someone quickly leaves a difficult, dangerous, or uncomfortable situation to avoid getting involved or taking responsibility, especially when there is an opportunity to escape. This often involves a desire to remove oneself from a problem or conflict as soon as possible, prioritizing personal safety or convenience over staying to resolve the issue. It typically applies to scenarios where individuals or groups choose to withdraw rather than face potential consequences or challenges.

definition: capable; clever; dexterous
context: When a person demonstrates exceptional skill and quickness in using their hands, often in creative or technical tasks, it reflects their intelligence and resourcefulness. This can apply in any scenario where manual dexterity and mental sharpness work together to produce excellent results. It is commonly used to describe individuals who excel in craftsmanship, art, or any field requiring both precision and ingenuity.

definition: all sorts of feelings well up in one's heart
context: This expression is used when a person experiences a complex and overwhelming mix of emotions at the same time. It typically occurs during moments of significant life transitions, emotional reflection, or when confronted with deeply moving events that stir feelings of nostalgia, sadness, joy, and uncertainty all together. It reflects the natural turbulence of the heart in response to powerful or poignant circumstances.

definition: words from the bottom of one's heart
context: When someone expresses genuine, heartfelt emotions or opinions without any pretense or concealment, especially in moments of sincerity or deep feeling. This often occurs in personal conversations, confessions, or when seeking to convey true intentions or emotions in a meaningful way. It is used to emphasize the authenticity and depth of what is being said.

definition: extreme benevolence, utmost duty (idiom);  meticulous virtue and attention to duty
context: When an individual goes above and beyond to fulfill moral obligations and show compassion, often to the point of exhaustion or self-sacrifice, without expecting anything in return. This can apply in personal relationships, professional responsibilities, or broader social contexts where ethical duty and kindness are prioritized to the fullest extent.

definition: clear and logical
context: When a person presents ideas or arguments in a well-organized and coherent manner, making it easy for others to follow their reasoning. This can apply in discussions, explanations, problem-solving, or teaching, where clarity and structure are essential for effective communication.

definition: ready to take any job, high or low
context: When a person is open to taking on different roles or positions, regardless of status or rank, and is willing to adapt their position based on need or circumstance. This often reflects flexibility, humility, and a willingness to contribute wherever necessary, whether in leadership or more hands-on, subordinate roles. It is commonly used to describe someone who values responsibility and practicality over personal prestige.

definition: may you enjoy boundless longevity (idiom); long may you live
context: When expressing heartfelt wishes for someone's enduring health and long life, especially in moments of celebration or respect. Often used in contexts where well-wishing for vitality and a future filled with many years is appropriate, such as in honor of elders, leaders, or cherished individuals. It reflects a universal desire for life to continue in a strong and prosperous manner.

definition: untainted by even a speck of dust (idiom);  selfless and incorruptible; spotless
context: When a person or organization maintains complete integrity and purity, free from corruption, moral compromise, or negative influence. It describes those who uphold strict ethical standards and remain unaffected by external temptations or pressures. This can apply to individuals, institutions, or practices that are considered entirely clean, honest, and beyond reproach.

definition: (idiom) (of two or more people) to take the same action without prior consultation;  (usu. used adverbially) all (or both) of them, independently;  as if by prior agreement
context: When multiple individuals or groups independently arrive at the same decision or take similar actions without prior communication or coordination, especially in response to shared influences or circumstances. This often highlights a natural consensus or common intuition in reacting to a situation, despite no direct agreement or planning among the involved parties.

definition: an overall plan taking into account all factors
context: When a complex situation requires careful coordination of multiple elements to ensure balanced progress, this concept emphasizes the importance of considering all relevant aspects within a unified plan. It is especially applicable in scenarios involving resource allocation, decision-making, or strategy development where overlooking one component could disrupt the whole. The focus is on maintaining harmony and effectiveness by integrating diverse needs and goals into a comprehensive framework.
